text.__SUMMARY__: Rhododendron kesangiae is a rhododendron species endemic to Bhutan, where it grows at altitudes of 2600–3400 meters. It is a tree that typically grows to 15 meters in height, with leaves that are broadly elliptic to almost obovate, and 20-30 x 10–16 cm in size. Flowers are rose pink, fading to purple.
text.References:
Notes Roy. Bot. Gard. Edinburgh 45: 331 1988 publ. 1989.
